author: Sarah E. Needleman
title: Apple CEO Tim Cook and NSA Director Michael Rogers Open WSJDLive Conference
text:
0 COMMENTS Leaders of industry will explore new opportunities and challenges shaped by the disruptive forces of technology when they descend this week on WSJDLive , The Wall Street Journal’s global tech conference.
Apple Inc. AAPL 0.12 % 's Tim Cook and Uber Technologies Inc.'s Travis Kalanick are among a handful of top executives speaking at the three-day event, now in its second year. ( The WSJ will live blog Mr. Cook’s interview on stage, which begins around 11:30 p.m. ET. )
The conference begins Monday evening with discussions on two compelling topics: surveillance and Apple.
Admiral Michael Rogers, director of the National Security Agency, opens the conference with a discussion on the delicate balance of spycraft as countries amass cyberweaponry on an unprecedented scale, and as the tech industry fights to shield its customers’ privacy.
Mr. Cook, who has thoughts on everything from the future of television to the future of driving, follows. He will be one of many chiefs at the conference who will talk about growing a company beyond its core.
International Business Machines Corp. CEO Virginia M. Rometty and Sony Corp. SNE 0.66 % Chief Kazuo Hirai will address the challenges of reinvention and shifting gears. Facebook Inc. FB -0.13 % product head Chris Cox will talk about the next act for a company that already counts its user base in the billions.
Bin Lin, co-founder and president of Xiaomi Corp., one of the hottest companies in China, will expand on his smartphone company’s global ambitions.
Other sessions include topics on scorching Silicon Valley startups and the kinds of changes that are upending traditional modes of life.
Bill Gurley, the veteran venture capitalist who sounded the alarm on Silicon Valley risk, will expand on what’s next for an industry where companies are hot and valuations are hotter. Yuri Milner, whose DST Global is funding a $100 million search for extraterrestrial life , will talk about out-of-this-world investments.
Uber's Mr. Kalanick and Slack Technologies Inc.’s Stewart Butterfield will discuss shifts in transportation and the workplace. Home Box Office head Richard Plepler will talk about one of the chief disruptions of our time: cutting the cord .
A session with model-turned-entrepreneur Tyra Banks will tackle how to empower female founders, while Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban will offer investing insight from a “shark.”
Mr. Cuban is also joining a global startup showcase panel that includes rapper-entrepreneur will.i.am, venture capitalist Theresia Gouw and News Corp NWSA -0.51 % Chairman Rupert Murdoch .
